page.title: 12Flour Millers of Chelmsford
page.content: The story of the business enterprise of{W.and H.Marriage & Sons Ltd.,}flour millers of Chelmsford, starts in{1824, 161 years ago. The{acreage}of all the farms is in the region of{1800, producing mostly{wheat & barley.}Only {10 men}are{now}employed on the two major farms where there{used to be as {many as 55 men,}the decrease being due to the latest types of machinery. 60 men work in connection with the mill including salesmen,lorry drivers and representatives.{250 tons of flour}are {produced each week}which is sold to bakers and institutions such as schools and prisons.Some export trade has been done in recent years,but difficulties at the docks made the profitability somewhat doubtful.Being a{family business}for over l50 years there is a{5th generation employee}as well as a{5th generation employer.
